The claim that the Green New Deal would: permanently eliminate all Planes, Cars, Cows, Oil, Gas & the Military" was made by President Donald Trump in a tweet and later repeated at a rally in El Paso.
Rep: Liz Cheney of Wyoming also made similar claims during a subcommittee hearing, stating that the Green New Deal would "outlaw" plane travel, gasoline, cars, and possibly the entire U.S. military.
The Green New Deal resolution: introduced by Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Sen. Ed Markey, does not call for any of these prohibitions. It focuses on tackling climate change and aims to meet 100 percent of the power demand in the United States through clean, renewable, and zero-emission energy sources.
Ocasio: Cortez's office released an FAQ document addressing some of the issues raised by Trump and others, clarifying that the Green New Deal does not seek to eliminate planes, cars, cows, oil, gas, or the military.
